LanguageData.RawPotatoes.label: Potatoes
LanguageData.ZP_RawJapaneseRadish.label: Raw Daikon
LanguageData.ZP_RawJapaneseRadish.description: Japanese radish. In cooking, Daikon is rarely ever the main focus; rather, it is often grated, chopped, or otherwise dispersed into a dish to compliment the main attraction's flavor. Daikno leaves are frequently used in salads, and are an important part of the Festival of Seven Herbs.
LanguageData.ZP_RawTaro.label: Raw taro
LanguageData.ZP_RawTaro.description: A small, potato-like plant, taro is officially categorized as a Colocasia esculenta, which are known for their edible corms (that being the potato-like part of the plant). Taro is useful due to its ability to sub in for Konnyaku.
